_exec_summary.SummaryText:

If there is no answer at the on-call phone number to confirm whether help is needed, CEC will than contact the next terminal employee in line to receive a call.  CEC will continue calling terminal employees until they are able to speak with somebody in person to communicate the situation (they will not leave a voice message).

The U.S. Energy Fox River Terminal has conducted facility tours with the Green Bay Metro Fire Department which included educating members of the fire department on the hazards of butane, evacuation plans, and assembly points.

Our continuous improvement process, inclusive of historic analytics, risk assessments, and corrective/preventive actions, focuses on three primary objectives:
1. Safety of clients, servicers, and community,
2. Up time performance and user experience and,
3. Site cost drivers and reductions through root cause analysis and long term corrective/preventive actions.

While uptime and site costs goals are easily quantifiable, Safety is paramount to U.S. Venture as this establishes our credibility and reputation with employees, communities, and the industry.

Safety and Environmental compliance are of primary importance to U.S. Venture at all times.

tanks, which is then transferred via piping and associated equipment onsite and blended into gasoline.  The quantity of butane that is stored onsite exceeds the 10,000 pound threshold quantity, thus subjecting the facility to RMP requirements.

The U.S. Energy Fox River Terminal's regulated butane process complies with National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) 58 for Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) Storage and Handling, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws/codes including Wisconsin's Department of Safety and Professional Services (DSPS) LPG System requirements, OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) rule, and DOT's Hazardous Materials regulations.  The Wisconsin DSPS has approved the installation of the system.   If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Green Bay Metro Fire Department by calling 911, which may trigger involvement by Brown County Emergency Management as necessary.  All personnel at this facility are 40-hour HAZWOPER certified and receive annual refresher hazardous materials training.

U.S. Energy has an outstanding safety record, and to date, has not had an accident involving butane that has resulted in death, injury, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.

In the event of an accidental release of butane at the U.S. Energy Fox River Terminal, Terminal Emergency Response Personnel have been trained to immediately activate an emergency shutdown device (ESD) at one of several locations depending on location of the release and is the policy of the terminal to initially contact the Green Bay Metro Fire Department (distance to closest fire station from terminal is 1.4 miles) and request their assistance (via 911).  The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with the Green Bay Metro Fire Department and Brown County Emergency Management.
 
When an ESD is activated and the alarm is not acknowledged within 20 seconds, CEC (Terminal Secu

The U.S. Venture, Inc. - U.S. Energy Fox River Terminal recognizes Safety Management as an essential element in providing a safe and secure place of employment for our associates, the public, and the environment. The corporate core values championed by our President, embraced by our Senior Leadership Team, encouraged by our Managers/Supervisors and pledged to our associates are: a) Caring Relationships, b) Entrepreneurial Spirit, c) Strategic Foresight, and d) High Performance. These 4 core values support our Safety and Health philosophy and management efforts. Interpersonal communications, problem solving, planning and safety achievement have a direct relationship with the core values when applied to safety training, hazard assessment/investigation, post-accident/incident recovery and generating solutions to potential risk exposures. U.S. Venture integrates Safety expectations as a part of Manager/Supervisors' responsibilities in order to create a meaningful daily presence during all work activity. All departments at the corporate level including Risk Management, Legal, People Resources, Finance and Operations reinforce strategic safety planning and solid operation level decision-making that will reduce risk exposures.

The facility is located on a 35-acre site in Green Bay, Wisconsin on the west shore of the Fox River and also located along the east and west side of North Broadway.  The property is located in an industrial/commercial portion of the City of Green Bay.  Adjacent properties include E.H. Wolf and Son's bulk plant and office, the U.S. Energy Buckeye Terminal, Canadian National rail yard and engine house, and MM Green Bay Cold Storage.  Petroleum products including gasoline, diesel, and denatured ethanol are received, stored and shipped out by truck, vessel, and/or rail.  In addition, butane is delivered to the facility by railcar on the west side of North Broadway and by truck transports on the east side of North Broadway to four 30,000 gallon pressure
